meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of saprophytes.
meanings.sent1: The saprophytic fungi help break down dead plants in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the saprophytic nature of certain mushrooms.
meanings.sent3: The saprophytic bacteria threw a party on the decaying log.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like a saprophytic force, feeding off old ideas to create new ones.
meanings.sent5: The image of the saprophytic vines slowly consuming the fallen tree was haunting.

meanings.definition: Obtaining nourishment from dead or decaying organic matter.
meanings.sent1: The saprophytic plants in the swamp play a crucial role in the ecosystem.
meanings.sent2: The vulture is a saprophytic bird that feeds on carrion.
meanings.sent3: The saprophytic caterpillar threw a feast on the rotting fruit.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a saprophytic sponge, absorbing knowledge from old books.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the saprophytic mushrooms growing on the fallen tree stump was unforgettable.
